intro.p: The GStreamer team is proud to announce a new release in the 0.10.x stable series of the GStreamer Good Plug-ins.
The 0.10.x series is a stable series targeted at end users. It is not API or ABI compatible with the stable 0.8.x series. It is, however, parallel installable with the 0.8.x series.

p.i: "Such ingratitude. After all the times I've saved your life."

intro.p: A collection of plug-ins you'd want to have right next to you on the battlefield. Shooting sharp and making no mistakes, these plug-ins have it all: good looks, good code, and good licensing. Documented and dressed up in tests. If you're looking for a role model to base your own plug-in on, here it is.

If you find a plot hole or a badly lip-synced line of code in them, let us know - it is a matter of honour for us to ensure Blondie doesn't look like he's been walking 100 miles through the desert without water.

This module contains a set of plug-ins that we consider to have good quality code, correct functionality, our preferred license (LGPL for the plug-in code, LGPL or LGPL-compatible for the supporting library). We believe distributors can safely ship these plug-ins. People writing elements should base their code on these elements.

Other modules containing plug-ins are:
gst-plugins-base contains a basic set of well-supported plug-ins gst-plugins-ugly contains a set of well-supported plug-ins, but might pose problems for distributors gst-plugins-bad contains a set of less supported plug-ins that haven't passed the rigorous quality testing we expect

features.feature: AVI demux push mode fixes and performance improvements
Support large and unusual chunks sizes in wav
Fix audio noise in the Equalizer plugin, and other improvements
Fix compilation on OS/X Snow Leopard
Support MPEG V4L2 devices and improve timestamping
Many other bug fixes and improvements

bug.summary: " Media Player Classic " won't play certain files produced by avimux.
TTL is never applied with udpsink/udpmultisink
avimux + vbr lame always out of sync
[avidemux] high memory usage for many index entries
Problem with RTCP thread using freed objects
[qtdemux] Add support for embedded subtitles
[videobox] Add support for autocrop to caps
[v4l2src] x264enc ! qtmux fails because of missing frame duration
[y4menc] interlaced support
rtpjitterbuffer sometimes outputs packets with timestamps in the past
[rtpsession] : rtp_session_on_timeout : Invalid read of size 4
effectv can no longer be compiled with gcc 3
[qtdemux] Lack of support for QualComm PureVoice
[v4l2src] format ordering: put emulated formats behind native formats
rtpjitterbuffer: clock_rate can change between its check and its use
missing unref in rtpsource / leak
[rtspsrc] leaks authentication info
missing math.h include in rtpjpegdepay
Use locked-state on internal rtp-bin to avoid shutdown-state-race
Avoid throwing out reordered packets with the same timestamp
jitterbuf: Only post a warning of clock-rate changed if it is changed from something initialized
propagate the pt-type-changed signal
rtpbin: make free_session() remove dangling stream references
Check if libsoup has SSL support before running HTTPS test in souphttpsrc testsuite
gstrtpbin always uses pt to demux
multipartmux: mark data buffer as delta-unit
videobox: converts AYUV to I420 incorrectly
Patch for multifilesink
rtph263pay: leak
pulse elements fail to connect to pulse 0.9.9
gstreamer crashes on pulseaudio latency change
[pulsesink] Lowers volume after every new track
qtdemux plugin should not return value from void function
Problem linking videomixer
[qtdemux] issue with corrupted 3gp file
[qtdemux] fails to parse pixel aspect ratio data
[flvdemux] not outputting no-more-pads causes playbin2 to fail badly on streamed single-stream flv
[avidemux] Fix printf formats to avoid warnings in avidemux
[qtdemux] Cast variables passed to printf to avoid warnings about incorrect formats
[jpegdec] segfaults on a specific picture
equalizer is non deterministic
[pulsesrc] has no lower bound for fragment size
[pulsesink] needs to take control of minreq value
osssrc rank should be secondary, just like osssink
Windows Media Player won't play large files produced by avimux
Plugins good do not build on Ubuntu Hardy (kernel 2.6.24)
rtpmanager: only forward the lost event to the last seen payloadnumber
[jpegdec] Regression supporting 4:2:2 jpeg videos
wavenc: Fix buffer offset by moving length incrementation
[pulse] Fix the StreamVolume interface not being advertised
v4l2: Make sure to initialize variables before using them
